content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's a nice and easy puzzle, perfect for a clash
Nice & easy, perfect for a clash or short exercice.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun with regular expressions. Just sad that in case of a tie, the greetings are not in a natural lexicographic order.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Keep up the good work!

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Quick and easy exercise for counting specific substring repetitions.

This instruction is inconsistent, like 'Greetings and words might not always be separated with a space they could also be like this: "Hi there!" so that hi should count', when in the example the word is separated by a space. Also says "hi" and "Hi" sometimes.

I also suggest to send `n` separate sentences instead of a huge line of text.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good exercise to learn regular expressions.

In test 4 there is a "Hey Amanda! How are you? Are you excited?"
But there is no "how are you" in the expected output.

Note that you do something very complicated and false in your solution. Even a simple "Hi!" would not been counted because of the punctuation mark. Maybe you can create some simple test cases for such tests...

You should use a regular expression using "\b" for "word boundary", like searching for "(?i)\bhi\b"

Goal section
* Suggest to change "all the greeting words" to "greetings" because the list doesn't contained **all** the greetings in the world and some greetings consist of more than one word.

* Please expand "most frequent: top" to a full sentence.

* Please mention that the count should be case-insensitive.

* Please explain how the greetings should be sorted in case of a tie in the number of occurrences. Please also state that their "places" won't tie (e.g. multiple greetings sharing rank 1).

* Please change "it" to "Each line of output".

* Suggest to change "[place]" to "[rank]", "[word]" to "greeting", and "[amount]" to "number of occurrences".

* Please format "." and ":" as {{constants}} in the structure.

* Please fix the typos:
   • "dont" => "Don't" (uppercase D and the apostrophe)
   • "occurences" => "occurrences"

* Please remove the example in the Goal section because (a) it's too long to display even on a screen expanded to the full size, (b) it lacks any explanation and (c) the Example section already shows an example.

* Please reword the important note so that explanation appears before any examples are given.

Output section
* Suggest to change "places" to "ranks" and "words" to "greetings", and "[amounts]" to "numbers of occurrences"

Constraints section
* Please delete "None".

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement (e.g. "write answer").

Thanks.

Thanks for the feedback, I changed it. in your opinion, are the tests (the user sees as an example) too long, shouldi shorten them so the user can actually see and count for them selves how many greetings there are? or is it ok? (because if I shorten it I would have almost no way of adding greetings so it would mostly be 2 occurrences or something).

You are right!
So sorry, ill fix it as soon as im able to.
Thanks :)
Thanks for the feedback! Fixed the problems, the separate sentences ill figure out and might add :)
Thanks!
Sorry it took so long, but its all fixed now and should be good!

Thank you for making the changes and raising the questions.

In my opinion, it's better for the first pair of examples to be shorter so that the players are able to read them to understand the clash more easily. It's ok for the other pairs to feature longer sentences.

Shorter inputs may be something like: "Hi, Sam!" "How are you, Jenny?".

Other comments:

Goal section
* Please remove all the brackets "()" - the sentences inside the brackets (e.g. "the most frequent greetings...") should stand on its own. Take care to remove all three pairs of brackets.

* Important note 1: Please put the example after "separate word".

* Please fix the typo: "its" => "it is".

* Please format all the greetings and example texts as {{constants}} in the three important notes.

* Important note 3: Tests 3, 4, 5, 6 and 8 don't follow the order mentioned in the note. In fact, the order is reversed.

Thanks again.

I changed it, think it should all be OK now.
I actually tested the text in IDE and read it pretty easily so I'd say its alright.

A few text issues to fix:

Goal section
* Please change "in in" to "in".

* Please change "input it" to "input. It".

* Please change "number 1," to "number 1.".

* Please delete "(" before "Don't".

* Please change "input)" to "input.".

* Please format "Hindi" as a {{constant}}.

Thanks.
Done
